raw_text:
Gallas sees two-horse race
 
 Chelsea's William Gallas believes they will battle it out with Arsenal for the Premiership in the coming months.
 
 "It'll be a two-horse race all the way to the end of the season because we are both going to give it everything," he told BBC Sport. "You need to be good and you need a lot of luck. You need a bit of both but it will be as hard for the Arsenal players as it is for the Chelsea boys." "We know that we have got the power in our hands just now," added Gallas.
 
 "But you never know what is going to happen in football - two seasons ago Manchester United picked up so many points towards the end of the season when they won the title. "Obviously, nobody at Chelsea wants to come second but you never know what happens in football. "We will be challenging to come first as much as every Arsenal player will be challenging to come first." Gallas has been given extra confidence by the impact manager Jose Mourinho has had since taking over as manager during the summer.
 
 And the French international defender believes Mourinho is perfectly suited to boss the squad of Chelsea stars and says his managerial expertise will prevent any player revolt. "It's only normal when you have got a team put together of such big names that you put the finishing touch to it and the finishing touch at Chelsea is a fantastic manager like Mourinho," he said. "He is the icing on the cake at the club. He has this fantastic knack of thinking of everything. "Another incredible quality that Mourinho has is that every player, even though the fans may consider them to be a stars, within the dressing-room they are absolutely equal. "Mourinho reminds everyone but he doesn't have to because he has created a wonderful atmosphere where everybody is playing and laughing every day. "It is a changed dressing-room from the atmosphere there was last year."
llama3.2:1b: Chelsea's William Gallas believes a two-horse race for the Premiership title is possible this season due to his team's potential, but acknowledges Arsenal will also be challenging. Gallas praises manager Jose Mourinho, who has been given extra confidence by his takeover, stating that his expertise will prevent player revolt and create a great atmosphere within the dressing room.
llama3.2:3b: Chelsea's William Gallas believes it will be a two-horse race for the Premiership between Chelsea and Arsenal, with both teams giving their all to win. Gallas credits manager Jose Mourinho for boosting his confidence, saying he's perfectly suited for the team and has created a positive atmosphere in the dressing room where players feel equal and motivated.
gemma2:2b: William Gallas believes Chelsea and Arsenal will compete for the Premier League title, stating that both teams are aiming for victory. He highlights the importance of both skill and luck in determining the outcome. Gallas credits manager Jose Mourinho's leadership with boosting their chances of success.  He praises Mourinho for fostering a harmonious team atmosphere despite the star power of Chelsea players.

Mourinho has given him extra confidence, stating that his managerial expertise will prevent any player revolt. Gallas also mentioned that Mourinho has the ability to create an atmosphere where players are playing and laughing every day. He further stated that their finishing touch at Chelsea is a fantastic manager like Mourinho.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Chelsea's William Gallas believes Chelsea will challenge Arsenal for Premier League title, citing Jose Mourinho's managerial expertise as key to preventing player revolt and preventing any player revolt due to high expectations of big-name players in the squad.
qwen2.5:3b: William Gallas believes Chelsea and Arsenal will compete for Premiership title, citing Mourinho's impact as manager and his ability to maintain player unity in team. He predicts challenging race despite having power at hand, acknowledging unpredictability of football.

He talks about the power aspect and mentions Manchester United's past success, but also notes uncertainty in football. Gallas says he's been given extra confidence by Mourinho since he took over. Mourinho is highlighted for his leadership style, being the icing on the cake with his strategic mind and an equal playing field among players.

I should make sure to include both Chelsea and Arsenal details. Highlight that Gallas believes Chelsea will battle it out but remains optimistic. Mention Mourinho's impact and how his team dynamics have changed since last year.

Now, I need to put all these points into a concise summary without explanations or any formatting. So I'll start with Gallas' prediction about the race, then talk about his team's unity and confidence from Mourinho, mention Manchester United's past success, and finally touch on Mourinho's leadership style and team atmosphere.
</think>

Chelsea's William Gallas believes Chelsea will challenge against Arsenal in a two-horse race for the Premiership season. He expresses optimism due to the team's strength and confidence gained by Mourinho's leadership. Manchester United's past success adds context, while uncertainty remains. Mourinho is noted for his strategic leadership and equal player environment, leading to a dynamic dressing room.
